They are beginning to desire marriages with foreign nations‚ now that they learn that there are no holier bonds to conciliate friendship between nations‚ and to settle wars—nay‚ how often they give laws to the victors. Many believe that the Czar divorced the wife whom he· has shut up in a convent with the design of marrying a foreigner.

THE CZAR's COURT.— The former Grand Dukes made use of inestimable parade in their apparel and adornment, the majesty of the Pontiff being super- added to that of the King. On the head they wore a miter, glittering with pearls and priceless gems; in the right hand they bore an exceedingly rich pas- toral staff3 their fingers were covered with rings of gold3 and above the throne on which they sat, there was fixed to the right an image of Christ, and to the left one of the most Holy Virgin Mother. The pres- ence and ante-chambers were thronged with men clad in golden vesture and other precious insignia to the very feet.
